Information about the upcoming leap second event if one is scheduled.

column7: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch.See the description of iTOW for details.

Information source for the current number ofleap seconds.0: Default (hardcoded in the firmware, can beoutdated)1: Derived from time difference between GPSand GLONASS time2: GPS3: SBAS4: BeiDou5: Galileo6: Aided data7: Configured255: Unknown

Current number of leap seconds since start ofGPS time (Jan 6, 1980). It reflects how muchGPS time is ahead of UTC time. Galileo numberof leap seconds is the same as GPS. BeiDounumber of leap seconds is 14 less than GPS.GLONASS follows UTC time, so no leapseconds.
